Table of Contents

Enum RuleActionType

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Enums
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Defines the possible automated actions that can be executed when an article matches the conditions of a user-defined rule or filter in the RSS reader application.

public enum RuleActionType

Fields

ApplyTags = 4

Applies one or more user-defined tags/labels to the article.

Behavior:

  • Adds specified tags to the article's tag collection.
  • Enables filtering, searching, and organization by tag.
  • Requires associated tag IDs/names as rule parameters.
ArchiveArticle = 9

Archives the matching article (moves to archive, hides from main views).

Behavior:

  • Sets article status to Archived.
  • Hides from active lists but keeps for search/restore.
  • Common for "processed" or low-value articles.
DeleteArticle = 8

Permanently deletes the matching article from the user's library.

Behavior:

  • Removes article completely (usually irreversible without backup).
  • Should include user confirmation on rule creation.
  • Useful for spam, duplicates, or outdated content filters.
HighlightArticle = 10

Applies a visual highlight (e.g., background color) to the article in lists/views.

Behavior:

  • Associates a specific color/style with the article.
  • Requires color parameter (e.g., hex code or predefined theme color ID).
  • Helps visually prioritize important matches (e.g., red for urgent, green for approved).
MarkAsFavorite = 3

Marks the article as a favorite (alternative naming for starred).

Behavior:

  • Functionally identical to MarkAsStarred in most implementations.
  • Retained for compatibility or user preference in naming.
  • Avoid using both in the same rule to prevent confusion.
MarkAsRead = 0

Automatically marks the matching article as read.

Behavior:

  • Sets article status to Read.
  • Removes from unread counters and default "unread" views.
  • Common for low-priority or already-seen content (e.g., newsletters user skims).
MarkAsStarred = 2

Marks the article as starred/favorited for later reference.

Behavior:

  • Sets article status to Starred (or adds starred flag if compound states are supported).
  • Makes article appear in "Starred" / "Favorites" views.
  • Often exempt from auto-archive/cleanup policies.
MarkAsUnread = 1

Forces the article to remain (or become) unread, even if previously viewed.

Behavior:

  • Sets or resets article status to Unread.
  • Useful for high-priority matches that should always demand attention.
MoveToCategory = 5

Moves the article (or assigns it) to a specific user-defined category/folder.

Behavior:

  • Changes the article's category assignment.
  • Feeds may support per-article categories independent of feed-level folders.
  • Requires category ID as parameter.
PlaySound = 7

Plays a custom or predefined sound alert when the article matches.

Behavior:

  • Plays an audible alert (device-dependent).
  • Should respect mute/vibration settings.
  • Use sparingly to avoid annoyance.
SendNotification = 6

Triggers a user notification for the matching article.

Behavior:

  • Generates a notification (toast, banner, push) even if global article notifications are off.
  • Priority and type configurable per rule or globally.
  • Common for keyword alerts (e.g., "job opening", "breaking news").

Remarks

This enumeration represents the actions available in the rule engine / smart filter system. Rules allow users to automate article processing based on criteria such as keywords, authors, publication date, feed source, content patterns, or other metadata.

Each rule can trigger zero or more actions when an article matches. Actions are applied immediately after ingestion/sync (or on first evaluation for existing articles).

Key behavioral impacts and system considerations:

  • Actions modify article state (status, tags, category) or trigger side effects (notifications, sounds, deletion).
  • Multiple actions can be combined in one rule (e.g., MarkAsStarred + ApplyTags + SendNotification).
  • Order of execution is typically the order defined in the rule configuration.
  • Some actions are mutually exclusive or have precedence (e.g., DeleteArticle usually overrides others).
  • Actions are executed server-side (if cloud sync) or client-side, depending on architecture.
  • User rules should be evaluated efficiently to avoid performance impact during bulk syncs.

Business rules and recommendations:

  • Irreversible actions (DeleteArticle, ArchiveArticle) should require explicit user confirmation when creating/editing rules.
  • MarkAsFavorite is included for backward compatibility or alternative naming; prefer MarkAsStarred in new implementations if they represent the same concept.
  • HighlightArticle requires an associated color or style parameter (not stored in the enum value itself).
  • Actions like PlaySound and SendNotification should respect global notification settings and device state.
  • Default behavior: new articles start as Unread unless a rule changes their status.
